config_description: Compression to apply to the commit log. If omitted, the commit log will be written uncompressed.  LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate compressors are supported.
developer_understanding_on_working: The commitlog_compression configuration is used to specify the compression to apply to the commit log. The code initializes a Configuration object with the commit log compression setting obtained from DatabaseDescriptor. The supported compressors are LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The commitlog_compression configuration is triggered when the CommitLog class is instantiated. It is also triggered when the resetConfiguration method is called for testing purposes.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the commitlog_compression configuration option on the system is that it affects the size of the commit log files. Depending on the compression algorithm chosen, the commit log files can be smaller (if compressed) or larger (if uncompressed). Compressing the commit log can reduce disk space usage and potentially improve write performance, but it may introduce additional CPU overhead for compression and decompression operations.
